tasks.task: Running a direct burial irrigation wire system
subtasks: Identify the appropriate wire gauge (16 gauge)
Determine the need for conduit (not necessary with direct burial wire)
Plan the wire's path from the controller to the furthest valves
Account for obstacles like sidewalks by pre-running conduit
On-site inspection to avoid crossing over obstructions
Tucking the wire under the irrigation pipe at each valve
Leaving extra wire (2.5 feet) coiled to protect against surges
Using waterproof wire nuts for secure connections
Routing wires through PVC conduit from the ground to the smart control
Connecting wires to the controller to determine which goes to each zone
Strip and test each red wire to the powered terminal to isolate zone assignments
